reviewText:
Early Access Review

Unturned is an Alpha Zombie Survival game (similar to DayZ), with the least amount of graphics possible for people with bad PC's, and to be more kid friendly. Unturned is said to be like a better, unglitched DayZ.

Gameplay
Gameplay is similar to DayZ/Roblox, some will say it's similar to Minecraft, but if they're judging it only by the blockiness of it's graphics, it's still not like Minecraft. The gameplay is very enjoyable and smooth, killing the zombies can become easy overtime (especially depending on the weapon and skill points you have), and the resource collecting concept of the game is a favorite of mine.

Multiplayer
Multiplayer in this stage of development is, not very much. You host your own server by either port-forwarding your IP, or using an external program that allows you to do so. So far, you cannot go on and join a random dedicated server just yet, but they're working on that right now. I've noticed very little lag/desync problems when in multiplayer, but I do notice, the more people in a server, the more desync is possible to occur, but the lead developer also said that he and a few other people are working on that now.

Graphics
Beleive it or not, this game actually has graphics settings. Optimised or not, they exist. Some settings really tax the game preformance. I usually run with all on low (besides resolution) to keep with the art-style of the game. And I can run with FPS range of 60-90.

Map
I wont rate the Arena" map
date: but I'll rate the PEI map
recommended: since Arena is a PvP map with items in the center and nothing but forests. The other map (PEI) takes place in Canada
voteText: a few cities
helpfulPercent: two farms
votesHelpful: a helicopter crash site
votesTotal: loads of zombies
votesFunny: ect. After playing for a while
commentsCount: I've gotten used to the map very quickly due to it's small size. One thing I would recommend for it
column16: is increasing the size of the map by adding more land
column17: cities
column19: etc. (there is easter eggs in the map already). By increasing the map size
column20: I think the game will feel much more involved and funner. Yet this all depends on the optimisation of the game
column21: and wether it can handle a big map or not. Doesn't have to be as big as ARMA's Chernarus map
column22:
but still should be bigger than it's current size.

Skills/Experience
Unlike a lot of Zombie Survival games I've seen
column23: this one actually has experience to it. You can get experience by hunting
column25: etc. and use said experience for say
column28: "survival" (increasing survival helps you not become hungry or thirsty as fast)
column29: etc. And as you level up your skills
column31: then you'll lose all that you gained. But once you have maxed out a lot of your experiences
column33: this game is really fun and addictive. Once I saw a few seconds of it on a Youtube video
column34: I knew that I had to have it

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Minecraft meets DayZ

and had a baby is the best way I can describe this game. Unturned is a block character zombie survival game where you loot towns for food, kill zombies before they get you, and if you're in multiplayer, try and kill other people who are in your way. Because of the cute nature of this game and it's free to play access, it's Suitable for Younger Children.

As of 2.2.5, the game offers two maps, PEI which is Prince Edward Island and an Arena map for hunting or very quick game play. Most servers are set to PEI because they have more to offer in looting towns, crafting hidden bases, and waiting for other survivors to come in to town. It can be hard to figure out where to go at first but after playing a few hours you'll get the hang of where everything is even if you don't find a map along the way.

Although, you have to remember that this game is Early Access and you will find the various glitches and frustrations that go along with that. There are bug reports being filed constantly and rightfully so. Even on a normal day without the baradement of glitches, you still have server lag, hackers, disconnects, and an unfriendly user API: It can be exhausting just trying to find a server, let alone play on them.

But, there is a saving grace to this. It's expected that 3.0 will come out soon and a massive overhaul will be set in place. Rather than going on server listings that are all but useless, there will be steam integration so players can join other players servers without spending half an hour finding them. VAC will be employed which will take out a myriad of hackers that troll the servers of Unturned with godmode, item spawns, teleports, and incredible server lag. There will also be a map editor for the connoisseurs out there. With all of the new implementations coming out it will dramatically change the atmosphere of this new anticipated game.

My opinion: for the casual player, this is a great alternative to play for a few hours and then to go play something else. For the more serious player, they will probably find their own server, get into groups, and become addicted to crafting for their own survival and the survival of everyone in their town.

--------------------------------------------------
If you're wondering, my credentials for a review as of 2.2.5:

- over 200 hours of game-play
- first guide comprehensively discussing the reputation system
- seven level 6 characters (skull/halo)
- killed 5,000 zombies
- and killed over 1100 players.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

DISCLAIMER: I know it's early access, and it's free. The following points should still be raised, as it reflects the game in its current state. Also, it's apparent that there are fanboys of some kind that downvote all negative reviews of this game, so I have heard. Now that I've seen this for myself, I can confirm that this is true. Careful when reviewing this game.
Another thing to note, is that I'm aware that the developer is only 16/17, and that he is the only one. This changes nothing. I am in no way putting that against him. I assess a game based on its quality/content, not on the age of the developer/s.

This game is somewhat lacking. Let's highlight the main points (in no particular order):

- The developer's skills are yet to reach their potential/are a little sub-standard.
- The tutorial doesn't teach you a lot.
- Even on easy, the first hour of the game is just spawn, run, die, repeat. It's a harsh learning curve that takes a while to get used to.
- You start with only 4 inventory slots. 4.
- 3 of the 4 inventory slots are filled on spawn. That's 75% of the inventory. You have one slot.
- Poorly balanced in places (some items are overpowered, some are underpowered).
- Crafting system definitely needs revision.
- Some items in the game are pointless.
- Changing the resolution in fullscreen will fry your graphics card for 5 or so minutes, leaving your PC unusable for this period of time.
- Controls can be very confusing at times.
- The community is often manic/unfriendly.

Good points?
- I've not yet encountered any bugs.
- The zombies seem to have adequate AI.
- Singleplayer practice, so you don't have to be thrown in with other people if you don't want to.
- Can be quite fun to play with friends, given that there's trust between everyone.
- Updates do seem to change enough to make it worth a look at each new update.

The game shows some potential, but it needs a lot of work to reach it.

On another note, the spawn

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Отличная игра. Убить в неё уйму своего времени - простая и приятная задача.

Если сравнивать с DayZ, то в последнем единственный способ выжить дольше нескольких дней - кооперироваться с другими людьми. Там вас ждут и драма, и неожиданные повороты. Здесь всё намного проще, казуальнее, веселее и бесплатно.

Здесь можно быть мирным фермером, забарикадировавшемся в какой-то постройке в далеке от ходячих трупов, а можно грабить караваны. И какое же удовольствие приносит последнее. Всё, что стоит сделать после входа в игру - найти холодное оружие. Этого уже достаточно, чтобы раскрошить пару человеческих черепушек. Когда к вам в руки попадёт огнестрел, а-ля УЗИ или Калаш, то всему живому и мертвому наступает конец. А потом вы умираете от того, что какой-то новичок с только что подобранным пистолетиком с половиной обоймы укладывает вас и забирает весь лут.

Крафт здесь не особо интуитивен, но проработан на высоком уровне. Можно отстраивать себе целые замки. (В сообществе игры уже не один десяток подобных построек на скриншотах).

Конечно, многое хотелось бы ещё увидеть в будущем. Это и более обширная карта, и больше разнообразного лута. Но парниша-разработчик постарался на славу. Обещает в скором будущем ввести в игру Steam Workshop и тогда пользователи смогут создавать свои вещи и карты для игры, что сделает игру просто конфеткой в моих глазах.

Что уж говорить о том, что всем этим можно насладиться, не заплатив ни цента.

Best of the best. 10/10. GOTY. Рекомендую всем, у кого из глаз кровь не течёт от плохой графики"."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Note: Yes I know that the game is in early access. I know theres bugs and issues with the game as well as theres things that aren't wrong with the game. And i will ignore any comments to this review that involve curse words and any hurtful or harmful remarks. Be an adult and take reasoning to what you're about to read, and don't get butthurt.

Pros:
+Pretty smooth gameplay
+Funny cartoonish feel to the game
+Nicely constructed map
+Creative HUD
+Not too many bugs for an alpha

Cons:
+The community is Aweful (Please refrain from getting butthurt about it)
+Every server is either full or has raging Prepubesent kids in it
+The zombies are insanly rediculous
+The inventory setup needs to be rearranged to a more preffered state
+Traveling isn't too time consuming but isn't worth only finding 1 bullet in a house
+Over population of zombies
+Crafting is next to impossible without google
+Tutorial doesn't help as much as it should

Main Review: The gameplay is acceptable and smooth. Everything runs fine and i haven't come across too many bugs. But it isn't the game itself that really has any problems, it's more of the people who play it.

If you are older than 12 this game is not for you. Just going to point that out. It WILL get BORING very very FAST. Wether it's naked kids running around killing anyone they see or overpowered players killing naked people, it's just really over all ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. There is no control in this game at all. Now I understand that its supposed to be some sort of mix of DayZ" and "Minecraft" but in the long run its nothing like either game. Minecraft unlike this game is actually enjoyable. The community is nice and everyone has a good time because things are controlled in an even environment. Now I know this game isn's supposed to be played like that but at least give fresh spawns a chance to actually get something done. Give them 15 mins to gather what they want and then expose them to the harsh elements. Maybe then it will actually be worth while to try in multiplayer. Now with the DayZ side
date: DayZ Overall is a much better game. Yeah I'll admit its a bit over priced for early access but its still a game that will keep us all entertained for hours and days to come. Let admit it
recommended: you just can't beat Dean Hall and his team. But enough of that. I think its cool that someone has created a cross between minecraft (Graphics wise) and DayZ (Gameplay wise) But actually make it enjoyable. Just because a famous youtuber has played a game doesn't make it a good game. I'm afraid with the way that the community is going with little kid over load
hoursPlayed: this game will soon turn into another crappy DayZ knock off. The game can go a long way and be really good
voteText: but right now its going down hill for those who actually want to enjoy it. Please take this review into consideration and be mature about what you say. Don't down vote this review just because you're 9 years old and can't stand people who don't like the games you play. Thank you for reading - Tucker"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Why you should ignore the graphics and give this a try:

-> It's free.
-> It's 153 Mb, so it takes like 5 minutes to download.
-> You could play this on a toaster. (If you've always wanted to play DayZ but don't have a good PC, play this)
-> It's fun.
-> It's regularly updated. (and it just has one developer, which is 17 years old)
-> It's not pay to win.
-> Steam Workshop is probably going to be integrated, so expect hundreds and hundreds of different maps/weapons/etc. to choose from.

-> Did I mention it's free? And that IT'S NOT PAY TO WIN?

The only major thing I don't like so far (which plagues every online game): Cheaters. But that can be resolved by signing up to a private server instead of playing on publics, the chance of encountering a cheater is much lower there.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Unturned is an excellent example of what the zombie survival genre has to offer. While it doesn't do anything significantly differently than other titles have done (borrowing heavily from inspirations such as DayZ and Rust), Unturned's balance allows for significantly more enjoyable gameplay than the brutal dog-eat-dog gameplay that the former two titles focus on.

Survival is challenging, but not impossible. Supplies are uncommon, but still plentiful enough that careful management of inventory and character status is the key to avoiding starvation rather than pure luck. Weapon rarity is particularly well balanced, as ammunition is scarce enough that I found myself grabbing firearms whenever I could, using them until their ammunition was consumed, and then discarding them as dead weight.

That is not to say the game is without its flaws. The zombie AI is rather basic, and either stands stationary or relentlessly chases the player. This is most egregious when a horde of zombies all converge into one tight mass as their AI all takes the same path, rather than a more dynamic system that would cause them to attack from a variety of angles. The map is an excellent introduction to the game, but is too small for the game to truly be a sandbox experience at the time of this review.

However, I believe these flaws are problems that can be easily fixed. The game is still being actively developed, and improvements to the AI and the map are inevitable so long as that continues.

In conclusion, while I didn't personally think this game did anything especially unique in its concepts, I found its implementation and balance to be excellent. By borrowing ideas from the great names of the industry but enforcing its own ideas of balance, Unturned creates a game that is significantly more versatile in how it can be played. Want a challenge? Hardcore difficulty. Want to relax? Easy difficulty. Want to survive alone? Singleplayer. Want cooperation? PvE servers. Want tension and paranoia? PvP servers. Want to kill lots of zombies? You can get the supplies. Want to build a base? You can do that. I would recommend this game to everyone, but particularly to those who have played titles such as DayZ and Rust and, like I did, found something lacking.

And hey, it's free. What is there to lose?

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I really don't see much reason to play other survival games with such a polished free alternative. Unturned is constantly getting updates and improvements, and the gameplay is very satisfying. Combat feels solid, crafting is enjoyable, and the survival mechanics make the game interesting even if you have established a strong base. I'm not a major fan of this type of game, but I can get hooked to Unturned for some time.

My issue is the list of tasks required to make real progress in these survival games. Want to build an object? Gotta get xp, gotta get materials, gotta keep thirst and hunger down; at some point the gameplay feels like work, and I'd rather get real things done in life. This is still a great option if you are a fan of survival sandboxes, completely free to play. I'd recommend finding a group to play as a team, as PvPvE prevents a lot of the awesome construction that is possible if people work together.
voteText: 13 of 15 people (87%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nWhile at first glance this game might not look like much but don't judge it by it's cover. Once you die a few times and get a feel of the game I'm sure you will come to love it. Keep in mind this game is still in early access meaning there are still so many great things to come to this already great game. This survival based game really make's you feel the struggles of trying to stay alive. Between keeping your food, water and radiation levels down there is always something to be done to keep you busy and keep the survival aspect of the game alive. There are plenty of places to see on the two maps we currently have and more maps are coming. You can play PvP with friends building untouchable bases and showing off your sniper skills or just survive with some friends looting and building a base to help secure your safety. Never fear, there is some comical relief in the game like beating zombies over the head with a frying pan; but don't take my word for it, come check out just how spectacular this game is for yourself.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I know this is an early access free game, with many stuff still in development, but that doesn't mean that it can stop me from making this review.

Good things:
+Two gameplay modes: survival on an island or an arena mode.
+Items can be found pretty easily
+Decent AI
+The dev (a 16 y/o boy) actually cares about the game, making updates frequently

Bad things:
-Community infested with little kids who only played MInecraft and insult everyone (also stupid PewDiePie fanboys joined) if they say that Unturned sucks.
-In most servers, players are just trolling rather than playing the actual game or they are raging kids
-Many zombies can see you from 30m away and never stop following you. If you can, you can manage to get hordes of 50 zombies after you
Overall, this isn't a bad game, but not good either.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is my first review so please don't be too harsh

Before you read the actual review you must answer at least 3 of the following 4 yes.

Do you like pixel games? (me: YES)
Do you like survival games (me: YES)
Do you like games where you must work together in order to survive? (me: YES)
Do you like games similar to Dayz, Rust and/or Minecraft? (me: YES)

If you said yes to at least 3 of the 4 questions, there is no doubt, you will love it. If you didn't, download the game anyway and give it a try.

First up, the graphics are really good and keep in mind the game is still in early development and there are a lot of hackers and bugs out there. In the 3.0 update however, 90% of hackers would be gone because thankfully the game is getting VAC (valve anti-cheat) and hackers will risk getting banned FOREVER. The gameplay is really fun and you have to watch out for 4 things, hunger, thirst, health and radiation. As you progress and search for armour and wepoans, you always have to watch out for the bars because if they drop, you lose all your stuff (unless you go back to that same spot). At the moment, death isnt a big issue because of REGEDIT and the fact that you can get your stuff back (in singleplayer). Once this is fixed, people will really need to worry about dying and other players.
So far, once you learn the basics, survival is easy and you start to get bored. But you forget one thing...you can build a base to store items and just look cool. You can create a farm to have an endless supply of food and make towers and bridges to get to nearby islands.
In this game, you simply cannot get bored (unless you only play singleplayer/pve.
Just one more thing. You finished a base, built a farm and got every single item and clothing set in the game. You have every attachment and endless amounts of ammo. This usually happens at 100-200 hours (depends how good you are). You are just about to stop playing this game until the next update, but your mind re thinks to the cars. Thats right, this games got cars, and just not one car, many different types and colours of cars. You start searching, looking, to find all the cars in the game. The humvee, roadster, car, lcv and the three emergancy cars: the police car, ambulance and fire truck. You think thats all, but strange rumours cross into your mind. What if there is one more car you think. Well you are right. The incredibly rare APC is the final car in the list. I have been fortunate to find one early in the game, but many people out there, have hundreds and thousands of hours and havnt found an apc.
Unturned: Build a base, Build a farm, Scavenge for food, Scavenge for water, Scavenge for medical supplies and Scavenge for guns. Kill other players and steal their loot, protect other players and form mutual alliances. SURVIVE

10/10

Early Access Review

Great game. Once you update this to 3.0, this game has some big changes and adds more content. This game also offers a lot a gameplay which can be improved even more with multiplayer with friends or random people even! I promise you, if you install this game, you will NOT be disappointed. If you want to play Unturned and don't know how to update it to 3.0, this is how.
1. When the game is installed, right click it and select properties.
2. Click where is says beta.
3. Enter code OPERATIONMAPLELEAF and click check code.
4. In the box above the search box, select the public beta branch.
5. Let the game update and enjoy!
I hope I helped in some way with others.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

At first glance, this game is just a great big ripp-off of minecraft... but is so much more.
This is the ultimate survival game.  Characters need both food and water separately in order to survive. Unlike minecraft, the ever-present zombies aren't knocked back a mile every time you whack them, so you have to use a little more stealth.  The stealth features not only crouch but also even more sneaky crawl mode, where you are almost completely undetectable.
And finally, minecraft doesn't have these vehicles.  From tractors to jetski this games pretty much has them all.  The driving interface is simple and easy, reminding me of Farcry4.

Altogether this game is a must-have for everyone and I'd recommend it to all
10/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is possibly one of the simplest crafted gamed, and at the same time, the most addicting zombie game I've ever played.  I do agree that this game looks a bit low in quality, but there are a few good things for this:

#1: These low qualities provide better gameplay for almost ANYONE, but if you can't get it running perfectly, than something may be wrong with your computer.
#2: Low qualities may give children the idea to play without realizing acatly what they're doing (Meaning this game is pretty kid friendly graphics-wise).
#3: Finally, these qualities provide a much simpler understanding when it comes todetermining what an object looks.  For some people, this is good to recognize things easily both inside and outside gameplay!

Not only that, but this game has a very simple gaming mechaninc, including crafting and realistic-looking driving.  However, I would suggest a bigger map, as it isn't very big at the moment.  Otherwise, this game deserves praise from me and a solid 9/10! :D

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has a great deal of potential! This game is free, you have nothing to loose by trying it out.

If you like this style of genre then defiantly give it a try, its quite generic and features all the core elements that survival, PvP, base builder needs. The only tainted aspect that hinders this game is the graphics, and if you can get past that its a brilliant game!

The devs are active, they bring out regular content updates, and I can only hope that they keep this trend into the future.

This PvP aspect of the game is smooth, I faced no real issues with gun fights, the recoil is interesting, it brings skill into a gun fight! It will handicap the less hardcore players, and benefit those who have the skill to control it.

Personally I struggled with the building side to this game, and was much more interested in killing people and hoarding gear, therefore I can't give a fair assumption on if its a good system or not. From the shot time I spent building it seemed far too complex, it tried to use aspects of Minecraft and Rust, but just over did it a touch. Either way, nothing that the devs can't fix.

I will round off this review by saying; if you have ever thought about trying it, do it. You have nothing to loose, and endless amounts of hours to kill on this game!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

okay
This game is simply awesome because of the graphics (no that's a joke but I prefer a game like this one than a crappy one made with cryengine). Take minecraft for the craft, dayZ for every survival aspects and take a tremendous coop dimension and you'll get UNTURNED. This game is amazing for two aspects:
On the one hand the game is good because it's open-world/sandbox, full of weapon (knifes, axes, bats, and don't forget m16, ak, guns and everything to enjoy). The craft aspect is truly large and opened (from the rags to the home floor or roof); you can use everything you find to create another one. And the loots are really interestings because for the mass of tools, clothes and surely weapons.
But on the other hand this game is tremendous cause of the social aspect: you could find a friendly spanishboy that will stab you when you dont look at him. And when you play with a friend the game reaches the state of masterpiece. You will feel you fight for your own life as in the truth and be frightened  whenever you see another player (the funniest is when you have an overcrowded server).
To sum up it's the best free2play game available on steam. So support the young creator of this state of the art game by buying the gold upgrade.
BUY IT NOW

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you're looking for a game that lets you live out your zombie survival fantasy for free, this would be one of them. Unturned is an early access free to play game that, while not visually appealing (which will probably change as development goes along), delivers on the gameplay. You are given absolute freedom to explore and do whatever you want by yourself or with friends. Want to build a fort? You can do that. Want to become bandits and kill people? You can do that too. Want to go on a murderous zombie killing spree? There are a variety of vehicles, equipment and weapons you can find to help you do just that. With frequent developer updates and community support, the game is heading in the right direction for a successful launch. Granted, it's not perfect. I would definitely want to see zombie AI get a bit more love, and being inflicted with bleed can kill you quite quickly (intended or not, I'm not sure).  However, as it stands now in its current state, I can confidently recommend this free early access game.

I've also written a more in depth early access review and first impressions which you can view by visiting the website below:
http://freetoplayreview.com/unturned-early-access-review-and-first-impressions

If you're looking for a game that lets you live out your zombie survival fantasy for free, this would be one of them. Unturned is an early access free to play game that, while not visually appealing (which will probably change as development goes along), delivers on the gameplay. You are given absolute freedom to explore and do whatever you want by yourself or with friends. Want to build a fort? You can do that. Want to become bandits and kill people? You can do that too. Want to go on a murderous zombie killing spree? There are a variety of vehicles, equipment and weapons you can find to help you do just that. With frequent developer updates and community support, the game is heading in the right direction for a successful launch. Granted, it's not perfect. I would definitely want to see zombie AI get a bit more love, and being inflicted with bleed can kill you quite quickly (intended or not, I'm not sure).  However, as it stands now in its current state, I can confidently recommend this free early access game.

I've also written a more in depth early access review and first impressions which you can view by visiting the website below:
http://freetoplayreview.com/unturned-early-access-review-and-first-impressions

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I absolutely loved the game before the 3.0 update. However, that is due to the fact that everything I had gained VANISHED with the update. I had spent over 150 hours perfecting everything and enjoying the game, and it all went downhill.
Although, it has its own servers now, so that makes it so much easier to play with friends. The crafting system completely changed in the update, but it became more user friendly (I had made a guide for 2.0 to link to in my web browser on Steam because there was literally no way to know how to make anything without just trying different items). I'll be getting back into it to find out if it's gotten better since the update (cars went from 0 to 99999999 almost instantly, flying around and crashing, zombies ragdolled like crazy, and everything was just off from what it used to be).

First of all, this IS NOT a cheap Minecraft clone.

It has a great potential, you can even feel it in Early Access stage. Playing alone isn't so fun, so, please consider to play with others. There is a few guides about how to host a listening server (personally i couldn't play this with Tunngle, used good old Hamachi).

If you seek predominantly mining, crafting something and erect buildings, you would like to skip this title. However, there is also mining, gathering and crafting; but they aren't necessary. The game itself about survival, finding resources and balance your needs like eating, drinking and intoxication.

Please give it a try.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nAlot of the open world zombie survival games with food mechanics and such, are either 2 things. One is the fact that they are expensive, dropping $20 - $40 per game, and two, they are simply unplayable. Not because of the game itself, but the fact that they are always run on  a server (not all the time but quite often) so you have to play online, which yes adds immertion and a sense of danger, but it can be annoying as well, admins with powers, kids camping an area not letting you touch it at all, and it can get too choatic. Unturned has a model I would love to see in other games like it (A few examples are, DayZ, DayZ Mod, Infestation Survivor Stories *cough* WarZ *cough*, H1Z1 etc.).  Unturned offers offline player, when you are the soul survivor of the apocalypse in canada, online play with or without friendly fire which is great if you want to play with others but not deal with too much danger (although a terrible community mind you). Personally I suggest getting a bunch of friends, all hooking up on hamachi, and go ahead and start a game, just for a small party. It's all up to you. I honestly would give it 10/10 but sadly there are no zombie moose at all, like it takes place in canada but no zombie moose. So it's an easy 9/10.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThe consept of this game is great. It runs nice, it plays nice, loadsa fun. Except for the community, which is... lets just say horrible. Everybody will shoot you on sight, if you manage to build some sort of a base, some dude is 100% guaranteed to either blast it to bits, or steal your loot and camp around your base and kill you until you either quit, or move to another location where the same thing happens all over again. Or you get banned for killing the friend of the servers admin, who attacked you first anyway. That is the PvP side of the game. In PvE, all you do is hang around people with highest tier items, watch while they kill zombies and give you their spare stuff. Fun right?! Atleast not for me. Single player is fun for a while, until it just gets too lonely.

The fact that one person created this, doesn't affect my view even if this is getting a bit annotated. There isn't much more to say, beyond me recommending the game for you to play.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A great sandbox zombie survival game, which can be very challening, especially at the start. With a great developer constantly bringing out updates and listening to the community and working on putting this on the steam work shop, if you play this and there's something missing from the experience then you can bet it will be added in time. The gameplay can begin to get a little dull if you are playing by yourself for a long period of time or several gameing sessions but just wait a few weeks and you'll get right back into it. PLaying with friends adds a whole new level, it's fun just being able to share resources and set each other tasks while trying to avoid your ankles being gnawed off by zombies.  For a free game this is truly fantastic and a must get for almost anyone.

10/10 would die to own barbed wire repeatedly again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Update: I've decided to update my review because I don't think I really went into too much detail.

Update 2: Still feeling like I didn't go into a good enough amount of detail, I'm going to try to squeeze out all of my critice juices for this.

Now I know I have less than two hours of gameplay for this, but hear me out. I have played this game a bit on single player (multiplayer will be the same thing except with people for deathmatch) and I felt like it didn't really bring anything new to the plate. For me, the graphics leave a lot to be desired. With simplistic graphics in certain games, it can bring out a kind of artistic feel in a game if done right. In this game not so much. Its on Unity, so I would expect a bit more than blocky, low-ress textures which seems unneccesary (just my opinion that I don't like the graphics). After reading other negative reviews, anyone with a computer with a lot of expensive, high-end stuff should just avoid this game entirely because its lags the game (don't know how because I started really getting into pc gaming this June) and the dev doesn't care so it most likely won't be fixed. The games programming is very well put together especially for a 17 year old doing a one man job to program it, yet it feels like he took a bit of the Roblox script and pasted it in the game. Specifically the magnet AI and from what I've heard you can walk enough to the point where you can have a whole hoard of zombies just following you. From what I heard with multiplayer, It became pretty bad since Pewdiepie showed his bro army" the game and I already played plenty these kinda games to know what multiplayer is like. I can't say that this game has potential because the damn "zombie apocalypse survival game" idea has been done to death since a famous Arma II mod came out. I know why I got bored with this because I already played the roblox version so I kinda know whats what. Get it if you want 'cause its free (except for membership) yet don't expect much change from its roblox counterpart because I didn't see it myself. Also don't expect a real change from any other generic zombie survival game because its going to take a while to find one thats unique from the rest."

At first I have to say that even though Unterned looks like Minecraft the two games have not many to do with each other beside the quadratic body structure of the Zombies and your avatar.

In my opinion Unterned is one of the best survival games which I have played.
The game offers you many crafting recepts and optiones to find your personal way of survial.
Also the gameplay is handy and easy to master so you have a quick entrance into Unturned.
Another reason to play it is that it have not many heavy bugs which reduce your fun to play.
But I have also to realize that one have after spending some houers into playing one have nothing to do anymore because you have explored and built all what you can.

All in all my result is that  Unturned provide many good moved survival game ideas and if we compare it with other early acces games it is highly advenced. The only negative aspect is that Unturned is not a game for months.
But guys it is free of costs and so: Why don´t give it a chance to get stored on your hard disk ?"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

There's a lot i can say about Unturned.
Although it is still in Alpha, i dont see a lot of bugs and glitches. It's a pretty well made game. Easy to pick up and learn.
The art style might not be for some out there but at least give this game a try. Small at the moment but im sure, Unturned will be one of the biggest zombie survival game on the market.

Mixing the elements of DayZ; clothing, armor, helmets, backpacks and mainly scavanging for food and ammo with creative elements of Minecraft. Using different tools to craft items, weapons and structures. May take some time to learn all of these but within the time i've played, i pretty much have seen almost everything.

I recommend playing this game with friends over hamachi and skype coz i tried playing alone once very early on, it was quite bad for me.

I give this Alpha a 7/10
voteText: 6 of 6 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Now I will start by saying I'm not an expert seasoned reviewer, and this is the first review I've ever made but felt this game made this review worth the time. Now I am familiar with the developer zackzak on roblox and his deadzone and battlefield games that I greatly enjoyed until quitting roblox 2 years ago. I found this game in my subscription box from etalyx's channel at YouTube.com/gamersdissent and free to play can't hurt. Also this is early access and that should be taken into consideration.

The pros:
- Amazing world to explore:
Variety of locations such as barns, small cities, airports, military bases. All locations have unique loot that makes sense in the location. Ex. Shotguns and seeds in barns while there is body armor and assault rifles at military bases.

-Intricate crafting system:
Lots of craft able items, from storage containers to car jacks, to even be able to construct entire bases. Wood foundations, used to make entire homes! Although learning the recipes is a curve and there needs to be a way in game to find them or atleast help as me and my friends were always on the wiki

-Free to play:
While there is a gold subscription for extra skins etc, the core experience is completely free, and just for doing that I'm considering buying the gold membership to contribute to the single 16 year old developing this game.

The cons:

Sound design:
Some if the sound effects, such as zombies and vehicles sound decent. But sounds like the guns, which are meant to be empowering with a sense of feel and force of such a weapon, sound flat and I feel as if I fired a water gun forwards my foes.

Unity engine:
While a developer like this may not have access to some of the more expensive engines to base their game on, unity was a terrible choice. Choppy frame rate even on decent hardware, even running any type of decent lighting is a performance killer, dropping to sometimes 40 fops or lower on my computer.

Servers:
At first playing with my friends was a challenge, no official servers to play on, no server browser, and now the 3rd party server host me and my friends were using has overloaded. There is also no anti-cheat system put in place so hackers were also a problem on the few public servers I was on. Item hacking, teleportation, dying from an unseen opponent then having them teleport to your next spawn, etc. Definitely not a welcoming experience, and framerate drops on servers is also common as many are hosting from their laptops/desktop and it's not always a 24/7 dedicated server either


Conclusion:
This game brings back memories when I used to play roblox with my friends all the time. Great fun to be had here and some great memories to have. Some performance and server issues and some odd choices for sound design hold this back, and I'm more into gameplay over graphics which this game excels in. C'mon it's free to play, updated regularly, give it a try and buy the good membership to support development

End Score:
8/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As of writing this, I have logged 715 hours on Unturned. You may ask why someone would put that much time into a free game. The answer is quite simple: I don't have a very good computer, so I play Unturned as an alternative to DayZ and Rust. Although, even if I could play those games, I would come back to Unturned now and then. Most of my hours have been logged as an admin on servers, but I've also logged 200+ hours of PvP. Unturned is a great game to hop on, join a kitpvp server, and have a go at other players. Even if you want to play with your group of friends and base build, it's non-stop fun. There's always something going on and the full moon nights are as fun as can be.

I have seen the 3.0 version of this game go through thick and thin; I've also seen it go from a great game to unplayable in a single update. Nelson tries his best to keep this going and keep it updated, and he does a good job. All the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t in this game that I have had to deal with -- from squeekers glitching into buildings/structures and killing me when I am fully looted out and them calling me trash" in chat; to not being able to teleport for several weeks as an admin due to getting stuck in the floor 96/100 times; and the game just not working in general -- has formed a sort of emotional bond with Unturned; I always came back to it and always kept trying to play it
date: no matter how ♥♥♥♥♥♥ off I was from crashing 8 times in 15 minutes. Not to mention that he broke Rocket Mod so many times that I lost count.\n\nUnturned is great for so many things and
recommended: as a server owner and having logged almost all of my hours as staff
hoursPlayed: I can confidently say that there aren't that many hackers/cheaters on this game. In all my 715 hours
voteText: I only ever saw three "hackers"; two were on devtest and one on Canada. One was flying around and I banned him within a couple of minutes (devtest). Another was spawning in gear (Canada). And the last was using god and spawning gear. I banned all of them
helpfulPercent: of course. I would have to say the only drawback of playing this is that there are 10x more squeekers than most zombie survival games."

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nWhen I first downloaded this I didnt know what it would really be like, I saw that it had a lot of downloads and there was a lot of YouTube videos on the game, but I didnt want to spoil anything so I tried it myself. First off, do not judge the game because of the graphics, this game really shocked me on how fun it actually is. Basically It's like DayZ & Minecraft had a baby, there's base building, and the guns are actually really satisfying to use. Also, the game is actually pretty hard, if you get a horde after you say goodbye to any chance of surviving unless you have a good melee weapon like a chainsaw or a good gun with enough ammunition, It's a great game, and it was made by a lone teenager, that's pretty impressive.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Do you like Minecraft? Do you like DayZ? Do you like both? Then this is the game for you!
In one game you can have both! Unturned is a DayZ like game with a Minecraft look on it :D
Become a bandit, or don't help them at all! The community is bad, so little people with be
friendly:P Be a lone wolf or get some friends and play together! You also have the base building
ability, which is an awesome feuture for an Early-Access game. In your base you can park your cars,
put some lights on it and defend it, and you can be that jerk that will make his base near the airport
and snipe some beaches.
By getting the Gold membership you get atm more skin colors, faces, a darker HUD and
a goald name so people will think that you area pro. On the other hand the game can become repetitive after a good amount of time is put into it, I personally think that going from town to town every single time with an axe to farm all the zombies and get killed by the nude noob with the kitchen knife is pretty repetitive. Other than that the game is very good with a friend. I give Unturned a good 8/10.-1 for small map and -1 for the repetition.
8/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you are even looking at the reviews DOWNLOAD THIS GAME, after 21 hours of playing this game within just a few days I can truly say it is amazing (AND ITS IN EARLY ACCESS ALPHA!). I cant wait to see how much better it gets. If you are looking for a survival type game play this. Think Minecraft mixed with Day Z. Since this is early access I have suggestions for the developers at the bottom (if they even read this :P).

Pros: You can get high as ♥♥♥♥ off of berries it is AMAZING (Do not take that out!!). Building your own multi-floored house. The survival feeling is truely rewarding. Customizable Weapons. Leveling System. Good variety of weapons, clothing, food and tools. PEI map is a good size and the islands are a nice bonus. Vehicles are different from each other (require more or less gas, drive faster or slower, take more or less damage). PvP can be turned off. Ability to grow crops. Doctors clothing helps prevent dieses. You can repair vehicles. Armor helps with bullets and melee.

Cons: Ladders can be annoying. Very hard to see when your vehicle is damaged (makes sense but damn its annoying). Crawlers can be difficult to hit. Nothing at the end of the bridge (Other than acheivement).  No boats for easy acess to islands (Yet?). Connecting with friends is a bit of a hassle. Unless you have a vehicle zombies do not give up the chase (if you get out if sight you should be able to get away).

Suggestions: Cars should be a little faster (fastet car go maybe 90 instead of 70 KM/H). Ability to make row boats (paddles and boat build sepertley). Add a boss type zombie (kind of like a tank from Left 4 Dead). Ability to wear a helmet over a hood (Like the miners hat or night vision goggles over ghile hood). Make the military vests able to carry a few clips of ammo (1-3 of the 30 round clips). Ability to swim under water would be awesome, could also add sharks and fish. Also ability to fish would be awesome (but make it that fish are only in certain areas). Ability to form a group in game for chest sharing (so you dont have to do it through steam) Add a defibulator (idk how to spell it lol) to revive friends within a time limit (20-45 seconds). Admin command console (spawning items would be to op but ability to turn off your hunger and thirst so you can host for people would be cool)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I must say that I personally love the hell out of this game. It is without a doubt similiar to DayZ, and like most games recently, has the blocky graphic choice like the much more widely known game Minecraft. This combination is rather pleasent and makes  the game have a little more humour in it. Now, with aesthetics aside lets talk on the gameplay.
In the game there are currently two maps available. The two maps are called Arena and PEI. Arena is basically a map without any zombies and is all about survival/constructing a base. Its useful to get started off in and to try out the basics. PEI on the other hand is all about the zombie infested towns and scavenging. There are quite a few towns to get supplies from, and clearing them out of any zombies can be quite a pain. But it is completely possible to do. A person can simply drive into a town and honk their horn to get the attention of all the zombies and then proceed to run them over. Now if someone doesn't have a car/truck to do this or want to risk the health of their beloved transport then they can always just run around the town until they get a good amount of zombies chasing them, followed by a long time of zombie killing. Guns in this game can be hard to come buy, and bullets even harder. But some people can take advantage of the item respawn when leaving a map. All items will despawn and reset upon the host/player disconnecting. (Though any constructions or vehicles will stay where they are) This allows a player to camp a certain spot and gain items from it very easily. It is a little cheap, but none the less a strategy to gain items. (One item people try to obtain is a certain backpack that has a large amount of slots available but a low spawn rate) One last thing that can be done in this game is turning Arena into a storage type of base in the start of this game due to the inventory being kept in-between maps.
Now certain things (Such as making a chest/crate for storage) requires the player to use the leveling up system in the game. Chopping down things or killing other things (With something  besides a vehicle) lets the player gain experience that can then be used to purchase a wide variety of skill improvement. This include endurance, health, crafting, and among some others. It adds to the game and makes it rather enjoyable to play. The only downside is that if you die, depending on how developed your traits are, you shall lose experience.
Finally, this game has many other aspects that could be explored with very few things that can be seen as annoying. (Though one of them being ladders) But talking about it in this review " would take up a lot of time and space. So all in all I recoment this game to people who enjoy some of the previously mentioned games at the start of this.

Also
date: players that find it annoying to constantly try and figure out how to make certain things can always use a wiki. (There are a few different wiki's for this game)"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I suppose I can write a serious review for the first time in a while. This game is in early access so any reviews on here positive or negative are completely subject to change and could be completely irrelevant overtime, however these are MY OPINIONS on the game as of now.

Okay first off this game is made by a single 17 year old and I have major respect for him to be doing something of this caliber at his age, good on you. Now for the review, this game is bound to be compared to dayz and minecraft for very obvious reasons, and as sombody who loves minecraft and dayz, I thought this game would be perfect for me. However this game falls in a grey area for me and I really didn't find any enjoyment from playing it. It doesn't offer the hardcore experience dayz has, nor the endless exploration that minecraft offers. I realize that base building is totally in the game however it just doesn't compare to minecraft's. The zombies are very unthreatening and if they manage to kill you the map is small enough where you can fairly easily reclaim all your lost gear in a short amount of time which takes away a fear of death, which is very important in a survival game. If you want a survival game with building and enemies just play minecraft, and if you want a more hardcore survival zombie game play DayZ. I'd say if you're a really young kid who may not want to or may not be allowed to play DayZ you'd certainly find more enjoyment out of this game than I have. However otherwise this game doesn't offer any experience that you couldn't find a better version of somewhere else. All this being said though the game is free! Try it out for yourself and formulate your own opinion.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Unturned is a game by a 16 year old named Nelson Sexton. That alone is impressive, not even considering the fact that it is currently one of the most popular games on Steam – even going so far as to reach the third 'currently playing' rank in the statistics recently. Personally, I've spent quite a few hours on it – especially during the first few days of its release. I did review it before, but it was a short one, so considering the amount of time that I've put into it since then in such a short amount of time, I figured it was about time I gave it a proper review.

Unturned has been compared to many other popular games.I've seen many compare it to DayZ - the survival element, loot collecting and zombie murdering all fit in alongside the PvP. Another comparison is Rust - the base building style is very similar to what I've seen of Rust, so I can agree with that.

Many people also compare it to Minecraft in ways of graphics,I do not agree. I've played Minecraft a lot myself, so I can outright say that it's wrong to say it has Minecraft style graphics. Minecraft uses 16 bit textures on pretty much everything in the game - whereas about 95% of the objects in this game don't have textures on them at all, not to mention that the item sprites are not 16 bit at all, as with Minecraft. The blocky element of the game comes from simplicity - the only thing that I would personally compare with Minecraft would be that the player models are extremely blocky, but even then, that's because this game originated in another game called ROBLOX.

Now that my mini rant is over, I'll finish my review.
I love playing Unturned. There are lots of things that make me enjoy the experience - the loot, weapons and building are some of my favourite.

Loot SpawnsThere are plenty of different items to find in the civilian, police, militia and military loot spawns. You'll find building supplies, medical supplies, food, clothes, weapons and much more. There's usually quite a few things worth taking in every town, in fact, there's usually something good in most buildings. If you're looking for something specific, loot the correct buildings. Low on health? Check the pharmacy for medical supplies! Need gas for a car? Go to the petrol station or mechanic's. Food is commonly found in the café and pizza place (despite the lack of pizza in game), and surprise surprise, military equipment is found in the military tents, towers and the military base.

WeaponsThe weapons in the game are also great - you can find plenty! There are katanas, sledgehammers, bows, crossbows, SMGs and assault rifles (Also my favourite, the sniper rifles, especially the Timberwolf) to kill both zombies and players alike. Many of the weapons that can be found in this game are in-game representations of many famous weapons. The Zubenekov, for example, is more commonly known as the AK-47, and the Desert Falcon is distractingly comparable to the Desert Eagle.

Building StructuresAnother of my favourite things in Unturned which I've probably invested too much time into is building. Once you've gotten yourself some tools - an axe or chainsaw, a pickaxe and a handsaw, you can build up gigantic houses, bases, bridges - or as I've seen in some cases, even huge ships in the ocean! There's also another use for the supplies that you gather using those tools - creating crates and chests to store your hard-earned loot inside. The great thing about these is that stacking items will stack infinitely inside of storage containers, saving a great amount of space.

I could probably ramble on about the other features of the game for a long time, but I'll leave the rest of it for any of you who are still reading and haven't yet played the game to find out. One thing to keep in mind is that if you need more information on a certain feature or item in the game, you should go to the wiki. A lot of people including myself detail everything there is to know about each part of the game, so most of what you want to know will be there. There's still one key thing to remember before any of you who are still uncertain choose whether or not to try Unturned – it's FREE, so give it a shot!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Honestly, I haven't been in so much love with a game since Payday 2 and TF2. This game is downright fun. It has the classic zombie survival feel, but is much more lighthearted. the PvP is incredibly hard, as two hits from most weapons will kill you. Zombies are easy to deal with one by one, but in hordes you NEED a melee weapon The Building is fun, though you will need to grind for hours to do anythying impressive. Crafting is complex, as in have a guide nearby or you'll be stuck for hours complex. But once its memorized it is quite simple. The graphics have that indie/Minecraft charm, gameplay is fantastic, but gets a bit old after 40+ hours, as with the majority of games. With friends, though, the expirience is 10X better, and to top this all off, it's made by a single 17 year old. Holy. Fricken. Crap.

So, to Nelson Sexton, good luck in the world of gaming!
And to you, my fellow survivors, go forth in the land of Canada, where everyone has guns (according to this game), and screw some zombies over.

8.5/10 Very Moist.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

January 29th update:

The game has several game modes now, multiple official maps, planes, helicopters, and Steam cosmetics!

If you own any cosmetics, your character will always be wearing them on any servers you play on (yay to not running around nude ever again!), but they won't offer any protection or storage value to your inventory. As they should be, they're purely cosmetic with no real benefits.

The game also supports Steam Workshop now, so you can add community-made maps, vehicles, weapons and more into your game if you get bored of the vanilla experience and want to mix it up a bit.

My main gripe with 3.0 is that it has been out longer than a year now and STILL lacks some 2.0 content (shutters for windows, the lever action shotgun, the Swissgewehr, and most of the backpacks), but that can easily be countered by how much new content there is, such as the airborne vehicles.

It's free to play and you have nothing to lose by trying it out, so if you're interested in it at all, definitely check the game out!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

After playing through this game over and over and over again, I think it's right for me to write a review. First off, I'm gonna start off with the pros, and then after that, the cons.

Pros:
+The game is fun, there's a lot of stuff to do. Since there's a lot to do, it makes you want to keep playing the game for longer periods of time.
+The community. The Unturned community, unlike a lot of these survival games, will help you out if you need to. Still, there's the occasional bandit that kills people, but that bandit will end up dying of thirst if he seeks for victims for too long.
+Items and crafting. Like I said, there's a lot of stuff to do. Unturned has a wide amount of items to make. The item spawns are pretty easy to memorize if you replay a map two or three times, which makes the game simple you're new, or if you die, you know where to go find some loot. And the crafting is pretty nice for the most part. Nothing wrong with it except maybe they should add it so you're available to all of the crafting recepies, not just few.
Cons:
-Items spawns. The item spawns can either be very good or bad. For the most part, a little overpowering. You could spawn in one of the villages and find probably the best melee weapon in the game: the katana(or the sledgehammer if you will). And other things, such as the lighthouse and the golf area has very few weapon and food/water spawns, so if you spawn at the lighthouse, you're screwed because you're gonna have to travel a long way if you wanna get to a decent place with a decent amount of resources.
-Zombie strength. Even if you fully upgrade the perk immunity and warrior, you can still die pretty easily from zombies. Sometimes, they're just a liiiiitle overpowered. If you get cornered with nothing but a katana and pistol, kiss those items goodbye, you're dead! (a group of zombies are fun if you only have a frag grenade. c:)
-Too addicting.(don't take this one seriously...) I can't stop playing this game without forgetting to do my homework.

Anyways, this is my short review of Unturned, and I hoped it helped you somewhat.

Step 6: Select from the dropdown list and pick "private"
Step 7: Update Unturned from the download manager
Step 8: Launch unturned

Early Access Review

OMG. This game.
When you start it.. i promise you are going to hate it.. so much.. zombies will be your worst enemy.. take my hint.. when in big groups of zombies just keep turning in circles and hit their heads.. and against 1 zombie just move back periodically as you aim for the head. now the second you get over your fear of zombies you will hate the game for the second most annoying thing. kids who KOS (kill on sight) now from time to time you'll always find someone like myself to give you shelter and help you out but KOS kids are going to make your life a living hell.. give you trust issues.. and wait till you get a decent weapon to shoot you with the game's best sniper just to troll. But never has this ever stopped me from playing this wonderful game.. updates making it better and better every time.. Make a steam group and invite some people and go on killing sprees on different servers.. kill other geared groups and steal their hard worked for loot  then trot away feeling like a boss. build your own mansion with enough players that it will never be subject to trolling destruction and simply.. when you start to love this game. you're not going anywhere.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

My opinion about the game:
The game is a lot like DayZ but it has its own spin to the formula. The maps are a lot smaller than those in DayZ and there is a crafting system in the game which lets you create makeshift items and bandages but also bigger things like makeshift vehicles and huise parts like walls and floors. The game gets an update every week and it is easy to get into the game.
The only negative part about this ame is its difficulty and the community. The game is very easy especially in single player! You can get fully geared in less than 20 minutes which might sound great, but when the community consists mostly of a younger audience, mostly 9-12 year olds, this gets annoying really quickly as you will often find those people just killing on sight and camping high traffic areas.

Overall I would recommend this great game! It's a lot of fun especially with a couple of friends. And after all, this game is free to play! Give it a shot! And for those wondering, yes there are in-game purchases, although they are only cosmetic.
Good luck and have fun!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I remember when i first got this game... at first i thought it would be all right so i spawned in on a server and began playing...


4 people beaten to death with a flashlight later, i was in love.

Now for the actual review:

Unturned is a free zombie survival game with fps and rpg elements thrown in, and is one of my favorite games. Includes 3 different gamemodes, survival which is the main focus, horde which is basically zombie wave survival, and arena which is just a hunger games mode. In survival you play the part of a survivor whom has woken up completley naked on one of the few maps. you then have to scavenge around for supplies and keep your hunger, thirst, and infection in check while not getting eaten by zombies, shot by other players, or dying of any natural causes.
My favorite part of this game is the combat, which includes a slightly higher than average damage model. (3-4 shots with an assault rifle and you are dead) There is no bullet drop or time, meaning skill is based heavily on how you control recoil (tap firing is a neccesity) and how well you can manuever and flank. The real downfall of this game is the community, which includes mainly kids under the age of 13. In all of my 1500+ hours of this game have i rarely met a person whom has not just shot at me on sight, of even tried to subdue me non-leathly, however this also means when you do get into a firefight, it is probobly with a 12 year old running the game on a mac book air. Most servers with an admin abuse their powers. The community does make some cool mods though, my only problem with the mods is most of them use ridiculously complex graphics which dont match unturneds style at all, and they are usually incredibly overpowered.
EX: a sniper rifle that can one hit kill you in the foot. So i highly reccomend joining a server with no mods or admins, and dont trust anyone you meet. If you are the kind of player who shows mercy and tries to talk things out, you probobly wont like this.

TLDR
pros:
-combat
-survival'n'sheit
-maps

cons:
-community
-mods

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a very interesting yet charming mix of DayZ Epoch or Rust with Minecraft.
It allows you to craft and level skills, you need to eat and drink, It starts you off naked in a world full of zombies, where you need to survive against the living and the dead, yes it is a pvp enabled game. It is way more fast paced than DayZ because weapon spawns are easier and the map is smaller, and also much simpler than Minecraft, giving you resource respawn nodes, and prefabricated building parts to create your base with. It is very smooth and fun to play, alone or with friends, but like all games much better with friends. I will recommend this game with its block style graphics and RPG like elements because its free and its awesome. The $5 Gold upgrade is well worth the Dollar because it will allow you to level up faster, and join Gold servers while adding a bit of style to your 'used to be nude' new/respawn. The money is well deserved to help the Developer, it goes to an outstanding 16 year old Canadian Developer: Nelson Sexton that made this game himself. Allot of support has been given since the day it was released and has reached Top #3 on most played game on steam.
Good game. Good Developer. Good price. Good reasons to try the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Early access Review:
Me and a few friends just got in the game, found a car, got gas, guns, ect and about 20 minutes in we thought we did everything. After about 2 hours of thinking about the game we decided to add another dude and HOLY ♥♥♥♥. We went 9 hours straight without EVER feeling bored. Not once did I feel the game was grindy, or not challenging. IN this game you need to watch your back. and make sure your friends watch it for you. Where simple things like packing a soda can choose life or death situations. Around 5 hours in we were having so much fun we completly forgot that we were tired and stayed up for 20 hours. This game is so fun and exploration is so great. The only things I want to be added is Bigger map, or more maps. LOTS of more content with better Item placing and options to reset the world. I would also like to have multiple saves/characters. PVP is pretty fun though I didnt mess with it much. Also make the crafting guide easier. Holy ♥♥♥♥ confusing
6/10 But with more content and patches reguarly then 9/10 This game is the most potential Ive ever seen.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Looking through the negative reviews, you will notice one major thing. Majority of them are under 10 hours of gameplay, a lot not even half that long. For my review, let me explain a bit about myself first. I do not watch Pewdiepie, I see a lot of people saying his crowd of bros ruined the game after recommending it or whatever. I am 24 years of age, not a child like most people claim this audience to be. I have never played on anyone else's server other than with my personal friends. All of this being said, I will now share my review of the game.

I saw this game being played by NGT(NextGenTactics) on Youtube, after watching their first episode, I decided to try it myself. I died many times, just like everyone else when I first started. Once I hit about 5 hours of gameplay, I realized how to survive against the zombies and how to survive the elements in general such as hunger and thirst. At about 10 hours of gameplay, I was no longer dying other than to surprises from the zombies and my friends in PvP. Now that I have nearly 50 hours of gameplay, I enjoy building new structures, running into military bases with a frying pan and still PvP'ing with my friends. If you give this game time and are willing to put in the effort to get over the difficulty curve, it is an enjoyable experience.

Yes, the developer of this game is young but he is learning and always improving the game and that is what makes this game stand out in my opinion. I was more than happy when I paid for Gold just to support him. I want to see what else this young developer can do now and in the future both with Unturned and whatever else he may release.

The game currently has two maps, with more in development, that take place in Canada. You find yourself without cloths and without any possessions(Dependant on difficulty) and either start on PEI washed up on the shore of a zombie apoclypse or in the middle of the woods where you must survive off the land in Arena. Currently PEI receives all the attention having zombies, firearms and so much more to it which makes it more action based and challenging.

I recommended this game to my friend who wants to play it with me everyday and I would still recommend this game to anyone willing to give it a real chance.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Unturned is a sandbox survival game with RPG mechanics and complex crafting system. If  you're familiar with games such as Rust, The Forest and DayZ there is nothing really ground breaking with Unturned but with a complex crafting system and structure building, Unturned has a bit of an upper hand compared to the rest.

You may be fooled of the graphics to see this as a casual game(which in my opinion shouldn't be in the genre tags)but Unturned is complex and deep as it's predecessors. You may see this as another Minecraft clone because of the blocky graphics but actually Unturned is more realistic and is more of Rust than Minecraft. You're basically put into a map where you scavenge supplies, collect resources, build a base and survive the coming days, but be cautious as other there are other players, they maybe friendlies or bandits that seek to steal your loot. With this, it gives the game a more DayZ feel as you have to be sneak around that a sniper may shoot your head at any time.

Other than worrying about your own head, there's a complex and deep crafting system that makes almost everything useful, even a moldy vegetable can still be used to make seeds or extra clothes can be used for cloth that can be used for making bandages or even fertilizers and the list goes on and on. Crafting is very essential for building bases and defenses, you can make walls, wooden shields, spikes, barbed wire fences and many more you can use to fortify your defense.

You also need to gather for food and medicine to keep you healthy. You're given 4 bars, 1 for life, 1 for hunger, 1 for toxicity and 1 for thirst. You can gather food and supplies in town and you can craft bandages for life as well, while medicines, such as vitamins are used to lower your toxicity. You may also want to settle somewhere near a water supply to keep you hydrated. You can also build a farm to have regular food supply.

You can play solo in single player and play I am Legend" on your own or you join multiplayer and play "The Walking Dead" with other people. There are a lot of dedicated servers you can join that has regular server resets to maintain upkeep especially when there are many players online. And the most wonderful thing about Unturned
hoursPlayed: every last content of the game but there's also a purchasable Permanent(I cannot stress this enough) Gold Status and you can join in gold servers and look cool for the low-low price of $4.99(Keep note: This is not a pay-to-win thing and more of  priority and vanity
voteText: which is not bad for the price of a one-time deal)\n\nFor an early access game
helpfulPercent: the game feels pretty beefy and packed. And to be honest
votesHelpful: I haven't really found or met any bugs
votesTotal: or zombies that walk through walls or in a different plane of dimention(ain't pointing any fingers lol.).Unturned is a well polished early access game with regular updates to back it up. You'll definitely have plenty of things to keep you busy
votesFunny: and it's actually a pretty fun experience. To sum it all up
commentsCount: Unturned is basically a free-to-play DayZ with structure building and a complex crafting system. How can you not like that?\n\nbtw. Did I mention it's free?"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is a simple zombie survival game, but fun and very action packed. You start out in a big world based on one of the canadian islands, your role is to survive, make a base, and survive the lurking zombies that will be after you. It isn't just a singleplayer survival game, it's also multiplayer! This means that you can also make a base with other players but with the risk of being raided and shot by others. It also has a unique ranking system so you can become the good guy or the bad guy (Bandit or Hero) these depend on what type of player you kill. If you were to kill a bandit you would get good reputation and it would be the oppasite way around if you killed a hero, you would get good reputation. This means people can fear you or want to be with you.

This game includes a massive variety of things though, including the massive amount of weapons, this varies from guns to melee weapons, then traps too. There are items that allow you to farm, cut down trees and mine stone, this allows you to make a base and prepare for the worst. There are also addons for the guns, armours and also medical supplies to make the game even more interesting. Also weapons can do different damage in different places in the body making it more unique, headshot baby!

9/10 People may find this game quite irratating and hard too.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A ridiculous amount of fun for a free game. Admittedly, I found it pretty difficult at first. As a Minecraft and Terraria player, I'm used to keeping myself alive as not being dire or critical to keep on playing. This game forces you to constantly be out moving and looking for supplies to survive. Once you have enough supplies, equips and weapons, then you're pretty much set and you don't have to worry much anymore. But that first initial burst of necessity as you wash up on shore with nothing (not even clothes) amongst a constant plague of zombies is a lot of fun.

I personally enjoy the scavenging and collecting items. On servers, you can either make friends or make enemies. PvE servers are typically more relaxed and let you hang out with other players. PvP servers tend to be more chaotic and become a mad dash to grab enough weapons and supplies to keep yourself alive from other players.

All in all, it's an insane amount of content for a game that's free and is constantly being updated to add more content and refine previous content. I was so convinced with the amount of enjoyment I was having with the game that I purchased a Gold account within 3 hours of playing the game. If you're on the fence - don't be. Just give it a shot. It's free!
